alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Renville; Swift; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lac qui Parle, Chippewa, northeastern Yellow Medicine, southeastern Swift, southwestern Kandiyohi and northwestern Renville Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Milan to near Boyd. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Montevideo around 905 PM CDT. Granite Falls around 915 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Maynard, Murdock, Clara City and Kerkhoven. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 52 and 66. U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 27 and 49. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 99 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and west central Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Renville; Swift; Yellow Medicine
